definitions.definition: To stray , rove , or wander from a normal course and others of its kind.
examples: He straggled away from the crowd and went off on his own.

definitions.definition: To act in a disorderly and irregular way.
To move along slowly so as to remain some distance behind the person or people in front.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To stray , rove , or wander from a normal course and others of its kind.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To act in a disorderly and irregular way.
To move along slowly so as to remain some distance behind the person or people in front.
